sentences.sContent: The hillsides in June flame with azaleas.
sentences.sContent_eng: The hillsides in June flame with azaleas.
sentences.sCn: 六月的山坡一片杜鹃花红似火焰。

sentences.sContent: The English countryside looks its best in May and June.
sentences.sContent_eng: The English countryside looks its best in May and June.
sentences.sCn: 英国乡村在五、六月间景色最美。

sentences.sContent: Her Latin is not very good, but it can probably be pulled up between now and next June.
sentences.sContent_eng: Her Latin is not very good, but it can probably be pulled up between now and next June.
sentences.sCn: 她的拉丁语不太好，但从现在到明年六月她可能会有所提高。

trans.tranOther: the sixth month of the year, between May and July
